hero.title: NINLARO® (ixaomib) Relapsing Patient Profiles
hero.subheading: There are different patients with multiple myeloma who are eligible for the NINLARO triplet regimen.*1
hero.references: *The NINLARO regimen includes NINLARO+lenalidomide+dexamethasone. The Rd regimenincluded placebo+lenalidomide+dexamethasone.

referenceText.text:
†Bruce is not lenalidomide refractory.
ASCT=autologous stem cell transplant; ECOG PS=Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status; FISH=fluorescence in
situ hybridization; PI=proteasome inhibitor; R-ISS=revised International Staging System; VGPR=very good partial response.

referenceTextTwo.text:
‡Alice is not lenalidomide refractory.
ECOG=Eastern Oncology Cooperative Group performance status; FISH=fluorescence in situ hybridization;
PI=proteasome inhibitor; R-ISS=revised International Staging System; VGPR=very good partial response.

ctaBlock.title: NINLARO could help Bruce
ctaBlock.description: The TOURMALINE-MM1 trial evaluated long-term treatment with the all-oral NINLARO regimen, demonstrating a 6-month median PFS benefit.1,2

content.heading: Bruce, 58 years old, facing a first indolent relapse
content.body:
Bruce is experiencing limited clinical symptoms, and his M protein levels have been increasing slowly over the past 4 months.

Reason for clinic visit

  • Monthly follow-up visit; has completed 3 cycles of VELCADE-based induction, M protein levels have been increasing slowly

Diagnosis

  • Diagnosed with multiple myeloma 3 months ago; R-ISS stage II

Treatment history

  • Does not meet transplant-eligibility criteria
  • First line of therapy was 3-cycles of VELCADE+lenalidomide+dexamethasone
  • Patient does not have evidence of progressive disease after 3 treatment cycles
  • Prior diagnosis of hypertension and moderate anemia

ctaBlock.heading: NINLARO could help Alice
ctaBlock.description: The TOURMALINE-MM1 trial evaluated long-term treatment with the all-oral NINLARO regimen, demonstrating a 6-month median PFS benefit.1,2

content.heading: Alice, 75 years old, active elderly grandmother at first relapse
content.body:
Alice has been experiencing relapse symptoms, so her physician is considering a triplet regimen.

Reason for clinic visit

  • Monthly follow-up visit; has completed 3 cycles of VELCADE-based induction, M protein levels have been increasing slowly

Diagnosis

  • Diagnosed with multiple myeloma 3 months ago; R-ISS stage II

Treatment history

  • Does not meet transplant-eligibility criteria
  • First line of therapy was 3-cycles of VELCADE+lenalidomide+dexamethasone
  • Patient does not have evidence of progressive disease after 3 treatment cycles
  • Prior diagnosis of hypertension and moderate anemia

threeCardsEnclosed.title: Continuous therapy outcomes
threeCardsEnclosed.description: Proteasome inhibition remains a cornerstone of treatment with optimal outcomes.

threeCardsEnclosed.title: NINLARO real-world studies
threeCardsEnclosed.description: Real-world evidence can complement data from clinical trials.
